original: gang dag 'das pa'i srid pa na stong pa nyid la goms pa de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs shing stong pa nyid mthong ba'i sa bon yod pa'i phyir mthu che ba yin te /üîΩda ltar gyi dus na skyes pa'i goms pa mtshar po che med kyang skye bo byis pa'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa yod pa dang med pa'i mthar rtog pas rnyog pa'i dri mas ma sbags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo 'phags pa sh'a ri'i
analyzed: gang dag 'das pa'i srid pa na stong pa nyid la goms pa de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs shing stong pa nyid mthong ba'i sa bon yod pa'i phyir mthu che ba yin te / da ltar gyi dus na skyes pa'i goms pa mtshar po che med kyang skye bo byis pa'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa yod pa dang med pa'i mthar rtog pas rnyog pa'i dri mas ma sbags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo 'phags pa sh'a ri'i
translated: Those who have cultivated emptiness in past lives have great power because they have realized dependent arising and have seen emptiness, and they have the seed of that.

original: bu la sogs pas khong du chud par dmigs te /
analyzed: bu la sogs pas khong du chud par dmigs te /
translated: Even though they do not have the great cultivation of the present, they are not objects of the minds of childish beings. They are not sullied by the stains of the concepts of the extremes of existence and nonexistence. They are focused on the profound dependent origination that is comprehended by noble Shariputra and so on.üîΩAs the guide has said,

original: ji ltar 'jig rten las dang nyon mongs rgyur byas byed rgyu ldan 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten las dang nyon mongs rgyur byas byed rgyu ldan 'byung ba //
translated: the world arises from karma and affliction as its cause and condition.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ldog rgyu de yang 'dren pas rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ldog rgyu de yang 'dren pas rab tu gsungs //
translated: The cause of the cessation of karma and affliction is also taught by the guide.

original: gang na skye dang rga dang rgud pa'i sdug bsngal nges par mi gnas pa //
analyzed: gang na skye dang rga dang rgud pa'i sdug bsngal nges par mi gnas pa //
translated: Where the sufferings of birth, aging, and death definitely do not exist,

original: thar pa mchog de smra ba'i khyu mchog de yis rang gis mkhyen de gsungs //
analyzed: thar pa mchog de smra ba'i khyu mchog de yis rang gis mkhyen de gsungs //
translated: The supreme liberation was taught by that best of speakers, who knew it himself.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus thos pa tsam gyis de kho na rtogs shing 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus thos pa tsam gyis de kho na rtogs shing 'byung ste /
translated: The moment the noble Shariputra heard this verse, he understood reality and became liberated.

original: de bas na de ltar sngon goms pa'i mthu nyid kyis de dag gi blo yod pa dang med par mthong ba las 'das so //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar sngon goms pa'i mthu nyid kyis de dag gi blo yod pa dang med par mthong ba las 'das so //
translated: Thus, by the power of previous habituation, their minds transcend the views of existence and nonexistence.

original: @4a * // mtha' gnyis de las lhag pa'i dbus med pa'i phyir de la yang gnas pa med pas mi gnas so //
analyzed: @4a * // mtha' gnyis de las lhag pa'i dbus med pa'i phyir de la yang gnas pa med pas mi gnas so //
translated: Since there is no middle beyond those two extremes, they do not dwell in that either.

original: skye bo byis pa rnams la 'jigs par byed pa dang / de dag 'jug mi nus pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo byis pa rnams la 'jigs par byed pa dang / de dag 'jug mi nus pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: It is profound because it frightens childish beings and they are unable to engage it.

original: rang bzhin gyis mi skye bas yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' dang dbus yongs su brtag pa'i yul du dmigs par mi nus pa'i phyir dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mi skye bas yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' dang dbus yongs su brtag pa'i yul du dmigs par mi nus pa'i phyir dmigs su med do //
translated: It is not an object of apprehension because it cannot be apprehended as an object of investigation of the extremes of existence and nonexistence or the middle, since it is intrinsically unborn.

original: 'phags pa de dag kyang rkyen gyi don la rnam par sgom zhes bya ba ni ye shes mngon sum du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa de dag kyang rkyen gyi don la rnam par sgom zhes bya ba ni ye shes mngon sum du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The noble ones contemplate the meaning of dependent origination means that they actualize wisdom.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa shin tu phyin ci log pa dag gis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don de ltar rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa shin tu phyin ci log pa dag gis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don de ltar rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: Those who are not noble ones, who are very mistaken, are not able to understand the meaning of dependent origination in that way.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis skye bar mngon par zhen pas stong pa nyid du smra ba la phyir rgol ba dang de bstan pa'i rigs pa btsal ba la brtson pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis skye bar mngon par zhen pas stong pa nyid du smra ba la phyir rgol ba dang de bstan pa'i rigs pa btsal ba la brtson pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: Because of the mere sound of dependent origination, they conceive of intrinsic arising. Therefore, they are opposed to the teaching of emptiness. They are devoted to searching for the reasoning that teaches that. Here it is said:

original: 'thad pa gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dmigs shing yod pa yang med par brtag nus pa gang gi phyir 'phags pa dag yod pa dang med par rtogs pa las 'das pa'i blos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo la rnam par sgom pa ji
analyzed: 'thad pa gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dmigs shing yod pa yang med par brtag nus pa gang gi phyir 'phags pa dag yod pa dang med par rtogs pa las 'das pa'i blos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo la rnam par sgom pa ji
translated: By what reasoning can dependent origination, which is perceived and exists, be understood to be nonexistent? Because of that, the noble ones, with a mind that transcends the understanding of existence and nonexistence, contemplate the profound dependent origination.

original: tsam du dngos po dmigs su yod pa dag med par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tsam du dngos po dmigs su yod pa dag med par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible that what is perceived as a thing does not exist.

original: gal te med du zin na de'i tshe bong bu'i rva bzhin du de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te med du zin na de'i tshe bong bu'i rva bzhin du de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, then it would not be perceived, like the horn of an ass.

original: 'jig rten pha rol nas 'dir 'ongs pa dang / 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar bstan pa las dang 'bras bu 'brel par 'byung ste 'khor ba'i rgyud mi 'chad par bstan pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis tshe rabs gsum du bshad pa yang mi rung bar 'gyur
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol nas 'dir 'ongs pa dang / 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar bstan pa las dang 'bras bu 'brel par 'byung ste 'khor ba'i rgyud mi 'chad par bstan pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis tshe rabs gsum du bshad pa yang mi rung bar 'gyur
translated: It would not be possible to explain the twelve members of dependent origination in three lifetimes, in order to show that one comes from a former life into this one and from this one goes to the next, and that the continuity of cyclic existence is unbroken, and that actions and effects are related.

original: ro // chos mngon pa las phung po dang skye mched dang / khams rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad pa yang mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // chos mngon pa las phung po dang skye mched dang / khams rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad pa yang mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be possible to explain the general and specific characteristics of the aggregates, sense spheres, and components in the Abhidharma.

original: de dag thams cad ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du 'dug ste yod na rung bas de'i phyir rten cing 'grel par 'byung ba 'di yod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du 'dug ste yod na rung bas de'i phyir rten cing 'grel par 'byung ba 'di yod pa'o //
translated: Since all of these exist just as they are explained, and since it is possible, therefore dependent origination exists.

original: bshad pa / gal te khyod kyis /üîΩnyes pa thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te khyod kyis / nyes pa thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas //
translated: You have already refutedüîΩThe nonexistence that is the basis

original: med pa rnam par bzlog zin gyis //üîΩde dag dgag par sgrub pa'i kho bo'i nyon @4b mongs pa yang khyod kyis bkag pas na khyod kyis byas te bstangs so //
analyzed: med pa rnam par bzlog zin gyis // de dag dgag par sgrub pa'i kho bo'i nyon @4b mongs pa yang khyod kyis bkag pas na khyod kyis byas te bstangs so //
translated: For the arising of all faults.üîΩSince you have refuted the nonexistence that is the basis for the arising of all faults, you have refuted my afflictions that I have created.

original: yang bdag gis /
analyzed: yang bdag gis /
translated: You should listen to the reasoning

original: rigs pa gang gis yod pa yang //üîΩbzlog par bya ba ma nyan par gyis //
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis yod pa yang // bzlog par bya ba ma nyan par gyis //
translated: By which existence is also refuted.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs yin par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs yin par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par shes par bya'o ;
translated: Since this is the chapter on dependent origination, you should understand that the existence of the self is refuted because it is dependently originated.üîΩOr, since you have accepted the view of nonexistence that repudiates the connection between actions and results, you have repudiated all mundane and supramundane roots of virtue.

original: / yang na med pa can las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la skur pa 'debs pas med par lta ba khas blangs pa gang yin pa de 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus pa sun 'byin par gyur pas nyes pa
analyzed: / yang na med pa can las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la skur pa 'debs pas med par lta ba khas blangs pa gang yin pa de 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus pa sun 'byin par gyur pas nyes pa
translated: Since you have repudiated all roots of virtue, you have created the karma that leads to the most severe of all bad rebirths.

original: thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad stsogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir nyes pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas te /
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad stsogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir nyes pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas te /
translated: because it is the cause of the origination of all things and the cause of the accumulation of all unwholesome things.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tshe rabs gsum pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi spyi'i las kyis bskyed pa snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs rnam par gzhog pa na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tshe rabs gsum pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi spyi'i las kyis bskyed pa snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs rnam par gzhog pa na /
translated: When the various worlds of sentient beings are destroyed by the collective karma of all sentient beings, the worlds of sentient beings and the worlds of their container are destroyed.

original: de'i chos mngon pa las rnam par bzlog go //
analyzed: de'i chos mngon pa las rnam par bzlog go //
translated: The Abhidharma explains the reverse of this.

original: de bas na de ltar pha rol dag la gsal ba'i phyir de yang rigs pa mi bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar pha rol dag la gsal ba'i phyir de yang rigs pa mi bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since this is clear to others, it is not explained here.

original: yod pa bzlog pa ni dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yod pa bzlog pa ni dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: The refutation of existence is as follows:

original: mi slu ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni bden pa'i mchog gcig pu'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni bden pa'i mchog gcig pu'o //
translated: Monks, this is the one supreme truth, namely, nirvana, which is non-deceptive.

original: 'du byed thams cad snod kyi 'jig rten mi brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad snod kyi 'jig rten mi brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can no //
translated: All formations are deceptive, having the quality of deception, like the worlds of their container.

original: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa na /
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa na /
translated: Alas, all formations are impermanent.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said this.

original: de lta mod kyi de phyir zhing btud de gzhung gcig tu ma gsungs la /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de phyir zhing btud de gzhung gcig tu ma gsungs la /
translated: Nevertheless, he did not say this in a single text.

original: byis pa dag yun ring po nas yod par lta ba la goms pas de'i phyir thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab de dang de dag las bshad pa'i gsung rab las btus te /
analyzed: byis pa dag yun ring po nas yod par lta ba la goms pas de'i phyir thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab de dang de dag las bshad pa'i gsung rab las btus te /
translated: Because fools are accustomed to the view of existence for a long time, therefore, in this treatise, I have collected the scriptures explained in this and that utterance of the Sage.

original: rab tu byed pa 'dir bsdus pa nyid kyis //üîΩrigs pa gang gis yod pa yang //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'dir bsdus pa nyid kyis // rigs pa gang gis yod pa yang //
translated: By this very collection,üîΩListen to the reasoning by which existence

original: bzlog par bya ba mnyan par gyis //
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba mnyan par gyis //
translated: Is to be refuted.

original: rigs pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are those reasonings?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩji ltar byis pas rnam brtags bzhin //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir / ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags bzhin //
translated: In order to show that,üîΩIt is said:

original: dngos po de ste bden gyur na //
analyzed: dngos po de ste bden gyur na //
translated: If those things were truly existent,üîΩAs they are imagined by fools,

original: de dag dngos med rnam thar du //
analyzed: de dag dngos med rnam thar du //
translated: Why would those non-things not be accepted as liberations?

original: gang phyir mi 'dod rgyu de ci //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis de don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang @5a * //
analyzed: gang phyir mi 'dod rgyu de ci // zhes bya ba smos so // bcom ldan 'das kyis de don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang @5a * //
translated: What is the reason for not accepting them?

original: dag par rig pa las mchog tu dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: dag par rig pa las mchog tu dga' ba skye'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said that the knowledge of the meaning, the knowledge of phenomena, and the knowledge of etymology are the causes of the arising of supreme joy.

original: rab tu dga' ba las bde ba skye'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba las bde ba skye'o //
translated: Happiness arises from joy.

original: yid bde ba las lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid bde ba las lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Physical pliancy arises from mental pliancy.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One experiences pleasure from physical pliancy.

original: bde ba las sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur ro//
analyzed: bde ba las sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur ro//
translated: The mind becomes concentrated from pleasure.

original: sems rtse gcig pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩyang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par 'gyur ro // yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One understands reality just as it is from a concentrated mind.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes /
translated: One sees reality just as it is from understanding reality just as it is.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mthong na yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mthong na yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one sees reality just as it is, one becomes disgusted.

original: yid byung na mi chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid byung na mi chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is disgusted, one becomes detached.

original: ma chags na rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma chags na rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one is detached, one is liberated.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mthong nas sems rnam par grol bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mthong nas sems rnam par grol bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, one is said to be liberated by the mind when one sees reality just as it is.

original: gal te don dam pa ma rtogs pa dag gis sngon po la sogs pa'i don de dag yongs su gcod pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid kyis phyin ci ma log par gyur na ni de'i tshe de ji ltar snang ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo
analyzed: gal te don dam pa ma rtogs pa dag gis sngon po la sogs pa'i don de dag yongs su gcod pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid kyis phyin ci ma log par gyur na ni de'i tshe de ji ltar snang ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo
translated: If the nature of the object, such as blue, that is ascertained by those who do not realize the ultimate is unmistaken, then at that time,

original: nyid kyi de kho na mthong ba'i phyir dgra bcom pa dag bzhin du de dag dngos po med pa'i mi skye bas len pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid kyi de kho na mthong ba'i phyir dgra bcom pa dag bzhin du de dag dngos po med pa'i mi skye bas len pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: because they see the reality that is the nature of the thing as it appears, they would be liberated by attaining nirvana without appropriation due to the nonarising of things, just like arhats.üîΩAs it is said:üîΩWhere the body is destroyed,

original: ji ltar gang na lus kyang zhig pa dang / 'du shes 'gags shing tshor bral ba //
analyzed: ji ltar gang na lus kyang zhig pa dang / 'du shes 'gags shing tshor bral ba //
translated: perception ceases, and feeling is absent,

original: 'du byed sbyor ba kun sun 'byin //
analyzed: 'du byed sbyor ba kun sun 'byin //
translated: the application of all mental formations is reversed,

original: rnam par shes pa nub gyur pa //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nub gyur pa //
translated: and consciousness has set

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: and also:

original: ma zhum pa yi lus kyis ni //
analyzed: ma zhum pa yi lus kyis ni //
translated: With a body that is not faint,

original: tshor ba dang du len pa na //
analyzed: tshor ba dang du len pa na //
translated: one endures feeling,

original: de yi sems kyi rnam par thar //
analyzed: de yi sems kyi rnam par thar //
translated: and the mind is liberated.

original: mya ngan 'das pa mar me bzhin //üîΩzhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa mar me bzhin //üîΩzhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Nirvana is like a flame.

original: de ltar byis pa rnams kyang yang dag pa mthong ba'i phyir dgra bcom pa bzhin du de dag thams cad btang bas mya ngan las 'das par 'dod par gyis shig /'on te de dag dgra bcom pa bzhin du thams cad med pas rnam par grol bar me 'dod
analyzed: de ltar byis pa rnams kyang yang dag pa mthong ba'i phyir dgra bcom pa bzhin du de dag thams cad btang bas mya ngan las 'das par 'dod par gyis shig /'on te de dag dgra bcom pa bzhin du thams cad med pas rnam par grol bar me 'dod
translated: But if you do not accept that they are liberated by the nonexistence of all of those things just like an arhat,

original: na / byis pa ma rig pa phyin ci log pa dag gang la ji ltar rtog pa de bzhin du nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: na / byis pa ma rig pa phyin ci log pa dag gang la ji ltar rtog pa de bzhin du nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then childish beings, who are ignorant and mistaken, do not ascertain things in accordance with how they conceive them.

original: de bas na de dag gi yod par lta ba ni de kho na mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi yod par lta ba ni de kho na mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, their view of existence does not see reality.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Therefore the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
translated: The eye, ear, and nose are not valid cognitions.

original: lce dang lus dang sems @5b kyang tshad ma min //
analyzed: lce dang lus dang sems @5b kyang tshad ma min //
translated: The tongue, body, and mind are not valid cognitions.

original: gal te dbang po 'di dag tshad yin na //
analyzed: gal te dbang po 'di dag tshad yin na //
translated: If these faculties were valid cognitions,

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis su la ci zhig bya // 'di ltar dbang po 'di dag tshad min te //
translated: what would the noble path do for anyone?üîΩIn this way, these faculties are not valid cognitions.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi bems po lung ma bstan //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi bems po lung ma bstan //
translated: They are inert by nature and neutral.

original: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa'i lam 'dod gang //
analyzed: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa'i lam 'dod gang //
translated: Therefore, those who seek the path to nirvana

original: des ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi bya ba byos ;
analyzed: des ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi bya ba byos ;
translated: Should practice the path of the noble ones.

original: / zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said:

original: de skad du 'di dag 'du byed log pas brtags pa ste //
analyzed: de skad du 'di dag 'du byed log pas brtags pa ste //
translated: These are imputed by the error of conditioned phenomena.

original: yang dag min la yang dag yod la med //
analyzed: yang dag min la yang dag yod la med //
translated: In the unreal, there is existence as real and non-existence.

original: ma byung ba dang ma skyes chos rnams la //
analyzed: ma byung ba dang ma skyes chos rnams la //

translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Even though it is not seen, it is designated as directly perceived because it is cognized by consciousness.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang yul rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa dang mthun pas sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yang mngon sum du bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang yul rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa dang mthun pas sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yang mngon sum du bstan to //
translated: Others also teach that another consciousness that appears as blue and so on in accordance with the aspect of the object‚Äôs intrinsic characteristic is direct perception.

original: 'di la yang de dang mthun pa yod pas de mngon sum zhes bya ba de 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'di la yang de dang mthun pa yod pas de mngon sum zhes bya ba de 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since this also exists in accordance with that, there is no contradiction in calling it direct perception.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa mngon sum du 'gyur zhes bya bar dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul yin par khas blangs pas dngos po med pa ni mngon sum gyi shes pas rig par mi rung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa mngon sum du 'gyur zhes bya bar dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul yin par khas blangs pas dngos po med pa ni mngon sum gyi shes pas rig par mi rung ste /
translated: Since you accept that the intrinsic reality of things is the object of direct perception, it is not suitable for a nonthing to be known by a direct perceptual consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni mngon sum du mi 'dod na 'gog pa shes pas 'gog pa'i bden pas ji ltar mngon sum du bya /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni mngon sum du mi 'dod na 'gog pa shes pas 'gog pa'i bden pas ji ltar mngon sum du bya /
translated: If you do not assert that the cessation of suffering is directly perceived, then how could the cessation of suffering be directly perceived by the knowledge of cessation?

original: sdug bsngal mi skye tsam yang dngos po'i ngo bor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye tsam yang dngos po'i ngo bor mi rung ngo //
translated: The mere nonarising of suffering is also not suitable as the entity of a thing.

original: gang sdug bsngal mi skye tsam 'gog pa yin par mi 'dod kyang sdug bsngal mi skye tsam las don gzhan du gyur pa'i 'gog pa rang gi ngo bos grub pa bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal mi skye tsam 'gog pa yin par mi 'dod kyang sdug bsngal mi skye tsam las don gzhan du gyur pa'i 'gog pa rang gi ngo bos grub pa bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Even though you do not assert that the mere nonarising of suffering is cessation, you cannot demonstrate that cessation is established by its own nature as something other than the mere nonarising of suffering.

original: 'gog pa shes pa zag pa med pa ni mngon sum du 'dod na /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa zag pa med pa ni mngon sum du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the uncontaminated knowledge of cessation is direct perception,

original: de yang de ltar gyur pas de ni mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de ltar gyur pas de ni mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then since it is like that, it would not be direct perception.

original: gal te 'gog pa shes pa mngon sum du gyur na ni de'i tshe des yongs su bcad pa'i 'gog pa yang 'gags pas mngon sum nyid du khyod kyi gzhung ltar na ko bum pa shes pa mngon sum du mi 'dod na sngon po la sogs pa ltar bum
analyzed: gal te 'gog pa shes pa mngon sum du gyur na ni de'i tshe des yongs su bcad pa'i 'gog pa yang 'gags pas mngon sum nyid du khyod kyi gzhung ltar na ko bum pa shes pa mngon sum du mi 'dod na sngon po la sogs pa ltar bum
translated: If the knowledge of cessation were direct perception, then at that time cessation would also cease, having been ascertained by that knowledge.

original: pa mngon sum du mi rung ba de bzhin du 'gog pa yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa mngon sum du mi rung ba de bzhin du 'gog pa yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If, according to your system, a pot is not asserted to be direct perception, like the knowledge of a pot, then just as blue and so on are direct perception, so too cessation would not be direct perception.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bla mas bstan pa las skyes pa rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa @9b gcig tu yul sgro btags pa med pa don tsam mthong ba gang yin pa de yang 'gag pa la mi srid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bla mas bstan pa las skyes pa rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa @9b gcig tu yul sgro btags pa med pa don tsam mthong ba gang yin pa de yang 'gag pa la mi srid do //
translated: It is also impossible that the object seen by yogins, which arises from the teachings of the guru, is not mixed with conceptuality, and that they see the mere object without superimposition.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dngos por yod pa gang yin pa de nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis goms par byas na ni rim gyis bsgoms pa las byung ba'i ye shes skye zhes grags te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dngos por yod pa gang yin pa de nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis goms par byas na ni rim gyis bsgoms pa las byung ba'i ye shes skye zhes grags te /
translated: It is well known that if one meditates on the general characteristics of that which exists as an entity with its own characteristics, then the wisdom arisen from meditation gradually arises.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de'i gzung ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang sgro btags pa med pa'i ngo bo yin pas na rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de'i gzung ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang sgro btags pa med pa'i ngo bo yin pas na rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: The object of that non-conceptual intuition is also just the intrinsic identity, since it is the nature devoid of superimposition.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid khong du chud na thog ma dang tha ma'i phyogs kyis stong pa dngos po tsam khong du chud do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid khong du chud na thog ma dang tha ma'i phyogs kyis stong pa dngos po tsam khong du chud do //
translated: Thus, when one comprehends impermanence, one comprehends the mere thing as empty of the extremes of origination and cessation.

original: de bas na de yang yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pas sngon po la sogs pa tsam la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du mngon sum nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na de yang yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pas sngon po la sogs pa tsam la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du mngon sum nyid do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since that is the intrinsic identity of the object, it is direct perception, just like the consciousness that observes mere blue and so on.

original: 'on kyang dpyod na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad par khas blangs pas spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa la sgom pa'i sbyor ba grub pa'i ngo bo'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang dpyod na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad par khas blangs pas spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa la sgom pa'i sbyor ba grub pa'i ngo bo'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: However, when analyzed, it is not tenable that the object of the essence established by the practice of meditating on the aspect of the general identity is the intrinsic identity, since it is accepted that the general and intrinsic identities are different.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i tshig de 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i tshig de 'brel pa med do //
translated: Because of the absurd consequence, that statement is incoherent.

original: de ltar yin gyis kyang 'gog pa la ni sdug bsngal ldog pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po'i bag tsam yang med pas 'gog pa shes pa'i mngon sum du ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin gyis kyang 'gog pa la ni sdug bsngal ldog pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po'i bag tsam yang med pas 'gog pa shes pa'i mngon sum du ga la 'gyur te /
translated: But since cessation is not even slightly an entity that has the nature of the reversal of suffering, how could it be the direct perception of the knowledge of cessation?

original: de lta bas na gsung rab las sdug bsngal mi skye bar shes pa ni mngon sum mo zhes 'byung bas skye ba med pa'i ngo bo de la shes pas skyes par byed mi srid de /
analyzed: de lta bas na gsung rab las sdug bsngal mi skye bar shes pa ni mngon sum mo zhes 'byung bas skye ba med pa'i ngo bo de la shes pas skyes par byed mi srid de /
translated: Therefore, since the scriptures state that the knowledge of the non-arising of suffering is direct perception, it is impossible for knowledge to generate the nature of non-arising.

original: gdon mi za bar skye ba med pa'i tshul du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar skye ba med pa'i tshul du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It must be done in the manner of non-arising.

original: de ltar na gal te dmigs pa bzhin du shes pa yang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin na ni shes pa de dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin pas zhugs par rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na gal te dmigs pa bzhin du shes pa yang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin na ni shes pa de dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin pas zhugs par rung ngo //
translated: Thus, if knowledge is also of the nature of non-arising, like the object, it is suitable for that knowledge to engage in accordance with the object.

original: 'jig rten na yang rnam pa de lta bus mngon sum zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang rnam pa de lta bus mngon sum zhes brjod do //
translated: In the world, it is also called direct perception in this way.

original: 'di ltar mgron po zhig gis rang gi mdun logs na yul chu rab tu dangs pa chen pos gang ba 'dra ba zhig rgyang ring po nas mthong ba dang / de rgal bar 'dod la nyams kyis mi nus shing skrag pas yul nas 'ongs pa'i zhing pa zhig la chu 'di ji tsam zhes smras pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mgron po zhig gis rang gi mdun logs na yul chu rab tu dangs pa chen pos gang ba 'dra ba zhig rgyang ring po nas mthong ba dang / de rgal bar 'dod la nyams kyis mi nus shing skrag pas yul nas 'ongs pa'i zhing pa zhig la chu 'di ji tsam zhes smras pa dang /
translated: In this way, a traveler sees from a distance what appears to be a great expanse of clear water in front of him. He wants to cross it, but he is not able to and is afraid to. He asks a farmer who has come from that region, ‚ÄúHow deep is this water?‚Äù

original: des de la 'di na chu ga la yod chu 'dra 'di ni smig rgyu'o //
analyzed: des de la 'di na chu ga la yod chu 'dra 'di ni smig rgyu'o //
translated: The farmer says, ‚ÄúHow can there be water here? This mirage is like water.

original: de ste nga'i tshig la yid mi ches na der song la ltos shig dang nga'i tshig ni mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: de ste nga'i tshig la yid mi ches na der song la ltos shig dang nga'i tshig ni mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa na /
translated: If you do not believe my words, go and see for yourself. My words will be confirmed.‚Äù

original: de chu med par @10a * //
analyzed: de chu med par @10a * //
translated: The farmer points out that there is no water there.üîΩThe traveler sees for himself that the farmer‚Äôs words are true.

original: bstan pas rang gi tshig kyang mgron po la mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de bzhin du med pa dang mi dmigs pa yang 'jig rten mngon sum zhes tha snyad 'dogs te de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pas mi dmigs pa'i shes pa
analyzed: bstan pas rang gi tshig kyang mgron po la mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de bzhin du med pa dang mi dmigs pa yang 'jig rten mngon sum zhes tha snyad 'dogs te de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pas mi dmigs pa'i shes pa
translated: In the same way, nonexistence and nonobservation are designated as ‚Äúthe direct perception of the world.‚Äù Therefore, the consciousness that does not observe the relative truth of the world is not a valid cognition in the world.

original: la mngon sum zhes bya ba 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: la mngon sum zhes bya ba 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in calling it direct perception.üîΩThat which is the instrument of cognition by which a thing is determined as it is, that is its direct perception.

original: shes pa byed par gyur pa gang gis dngos po gang gi don ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gcod pa de de'i mngon sum zhes bya bas na lung de rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa byed par gyur pa gang gis dngos po gang gi don ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gcod pa de de'i mngon sum zhes bya bas na lung de rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that statement is reasonable.

original: de la phung po'i rgyun chad pa'i ngo bo la ni gang yang med na 'gog pa de su la mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phung po'i rgyun chad pa'i ngo bo la ni gang yang med na 'gog pa de su la mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, if the nature of the continuum of aggregates is nonexistent, then when that cessation is direct perception, to whom does it belong?

original: gang skye ba zad do tshangs par spyod par bsnyen to //
analyzed: gang skye ba zad do tshangs par spyod par bsnyen to //
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúBirth is exhausted, the pure life has been lived,

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: what is to be done has been done,üîΩthere is no more of this mundane state,‚Äù

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba 'di la skye ba zad pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba 'di la skye ba zad pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang mi rung ste /

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig skye ba med na dngos po zad do zhig go //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig skye ba med na dngos po zad do zhig go //
translated: If some thing is not produced, then a thing is exhausted.

analyzed: yang mi skye'o zhes bya bar yang 'gyur na /

original: ji srid du de'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phung po'i rgyun 'byung ba de srid du de la skye ba yod pas na de zad par khong du chud par mi nus so //
analyzed: ji srid du de'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phung po'i rgyun 'byung ba de srid du de la skye ba yod pas na de zad par khong du chud par mi nus so //
translated: As long as the continuum of aggregates projected by its causes and conditions arises, it is born, and so it is not possible to comprehend its exhaustion.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba'i tshig las drangs te /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba'i tshig las drangs te /
translated: This is drawn from the statement, ‚ÄúI do not know of any other existence beyond this.‚Äù

analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ma mthong bas de skad ces bya'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that this is because future birth is not seen,

analyzed: yang de lta yin du zin na de'i dus na de'i /
translated: then in that case, at that time,

original: gal te phung po ma 'gags na //
analyzed: gal te phung po ma 'gags na //
translated: If the aggregates do not cease,

analyzed: nyon mongs zad kyang 'das mi 'gyur //
translated: then even though afflictions are exhausted, one does not transcend the world.üîΩA s≈´tra states:

analyzed: mdo las ni phung po 'gags na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: When the aggregates cease, it is called nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal 'di ma lus par spangs pa rab tu btang ba byang bar gyur ba zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa nye bar zhi ba nub pa sdug bsngal gzhan gyis mtshams mi sbyor zhing phyis mi skye ba gang yin pa de nyid zhi ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di ma lus par spangs pa rab tu btang ba byang bar gyur ba zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa nye bar zhi ba nub pa sdug bsngal gzhan gyis mtshams mi sbyor zhing phyis mi skye ba gang yin pa de nyid zhi ba /
translated: The complete abandonment of this suffering, its utter abandonment, its thorough knowledge, its extinction, its desirelessness, its cessation, its pacification, its disappearance, the nonarising of another suffering, and the state of no further rebirth is peace.

original: de nyid gya nom pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gya nom pa ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: phung po thams cad rab tu btung ba srid pa zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin te /

analyzed: de la mdo sde las sdug bsngal 'di zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni da ltar nyid kyi sdug bsngal dbang du byas te / ma lus par spangs pa nas nus par gyur pa'i bar du gsungs so // ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas te /
translated: In this passage, the words ‚Äúthis suffering‚Äù refer to the present suffering.üîΩThe words ‚Äúcompletely abandoned‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecomes capable‚Äù refer to the present suffering.üîΩThe words ‚Äúdoes not link with another suffering‚Äù refer to future suffering.

analyzed: sdug bsngal @10b gzhan gyis mtshams mi sbyor zhes bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa zad do zhes bya ba'i tshig ni da ltar nyid kyi mi skye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúnirvana is exhausted‚Äù refer to the present non-arising.

analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba'i tshig ni ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang sbyar bar nges so //
translated: The words ‚Äúdoes not know of any other existence beyond this‚Äù are definitely connected with future suffering.

analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na yang de'i phung po de dgag pa med na ni de mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi mthong /

analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa mthong ba de'i tshe na skye ba de mi dmigs pas sdug bsngal zad pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If the person sees the non-arising of the intrinsic reality of suffering, then at that time, since the arising of suffering is not observed, suffering would be extinguished.

translated: But since the other schools do not assert that, then at that time nirvana would not occur.üîΩBut the BhagavƒÅn has said that nirvana is twofold: that with a remainder of the aggregates and that without a remainder of the aggregates.

original: ci ste bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni gnyis su gsungs te phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa yin te de'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa ni phung po tsam du zad do //

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba yin /

analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa ni phung po'i rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba spangs kyang mya ngan las 'das par mi 'dod do snyam du sems na ni 'o na
translated: Since nirvana without remainder is characterized by the cessation of the continuum of the aggregates, it is not asserted that nirvana exists when the aggregates exist, even though attachment and so on are abandoned.üîΩIf you think that, then how do you explain this sutra?

original: mdo sde las rjes bzlas zhes bya ba'i mdo sde 'di ni /
analyzed: mdo sde las rjes bzlas zhes bya ba'i mdo sde 'di ni /
translated: The sutra called the Repetition of the Questions of ParamƒÅrthasamudgata states:

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yis mya ngan 'das //
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra actualized nirvana

analyzed: mngon sum byas nas bshad pa yin // zhes 'byung ba ji ltar bshad / de ni nyon mongs pa med pa mngon sum du bya ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs par nges kyi phung po dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba na yang gal te de lta yin du zin na gang sdug bsngal 'di ma lus par spangs shing
translated: and explained it.üîΩIf you say that this was stated from the perspective of actualizing the absence of affliction and not from the perspective of being free from the aggregates, then if that were so, this would not be explained:üîΩ‚ÄúThis suffering is completely abandoned and

analyzed: rab tu btang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag bshad par mi 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa de dag ma lus par spangs pa nas nub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du de skad gsungs pa'i rigs so //

translated: Since suffering is also dependently arisen, it is not essentially arisen.

original: gang gis ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: That very non-production by own nature is nirvana,

original: gnyi ga yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar yang 'khor ba las ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar yang 'khor ba las ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: because both are non-produced.

original: bye brag dbye ba cung zad med //üîΩmya ngan 'das las 'khor ba yang //
analyzed: bye brag dbye ba cung zad med // mya ngan 'das las 'khor ba yang //
translated: Thus, nirvana is not at all different from cyclic life,

original: bye brag dbye ba ci yang med //
analyzed: bye brag dbye ba ci yang med //
translated: and cyclic life is not at all different from nirvana.

original: mya ngan 'das kyi mtha' 'di ni //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das kyi mtha' 'di ni //
translated: The limit of nirvana is

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang de yin te //üîΩde gnyis la ni cung zad kyang //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang de yin te // de gnyis la ni cung zad kyang //
translated: also the limit of cyclic life.üîΩThere is not the slightest

original: bye brag shin tu phra ba'ang med //
analyzed: bye brag shin tu phra ba'ang med //
translated: difference between the two.

original: ces bya ba bstan pa yin no //üîΩmtha' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mchog tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba bstan pa yin no // mtha' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mchog tu byung ba'o //
translated: This is the teaching.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlimit‚Äù means ‚Äúsupremely arisen.‚Äù

original: mchog tu byung ba zhes bya ba ni phul du phyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mchog tu byung ba zhes bya ba ni phul du phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSupremely arisen‚Äù means ‚Äúsupremely gone.‚Äù

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin ni gnyi ga yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis gcig go //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin ni gnyi ga yang ma skyes pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis gcig go //
translated: Since the nature of the extreme that is the domain of childish beings is unborn in both ways, it is intrinsically non-arisen. Therefore, cyclic existence and nirvana are the same.

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yang chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yang chos zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because it is not different from nirvana, dependent origination is also called ‚ÄúDharma.‚Äù

original: de mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa yang mthong bas na sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
analyzed: de mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa yang mthong bas na sus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
translated: Because nirvana is seen by seeing that, whoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tha mi dad pas na mthong bas sangs rgyas mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tha mi dad pas na mthong bas sangs rgyas mthong ba yin no //
translated: Because the essence of the Dharma and the BhagavƒÅn Buddha are not different, by seeing that, one sees the Buddha.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skye ba med pa la dmigs pa'i chos shes pas rten bden pa gsum rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes la /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skye ba med pa la dmigs pa'i chos shes pas rten bden pa gsum rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes la /
translated: Thus, by the Dharma knowledge that focuses on the nonarising of dependent origination, the three truths that are its basis are seen to be dependent origination that is not inherently arisen.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang de'i ngo bo nyid yin par mthong bas mngon bar rtogs pa gcig tu zad do //üîΩde la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i @13a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang de'i ngo bo nyid yin par mthong bas mngon bar rtogs pa gcig tu zad do // de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i @13a * //
translated: And since nirvana is seen to be its nature, there is only a single realization.üîΩDharma knowledge that focuses on dependent origination

original: chos shes pa sdug bsngal gyi skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa'i bdag nyid de sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
analyzed: chos shes pa sdug bsngal gyi skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa'i bdag nyid de sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
translated: is the complete elimination of the nonarising and noncessation of suffering.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung ba shes pa'o //
translated: That which is the complete elimination of the nonarising and noncessation of karma and affliction is the knowledge of origin.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa ma yin pa 'di ni 'gog pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa ma yin pa 'di ni 'gog pa shes pa'o //
translated: That which is the complete elimination of the nonarising and noncessation of dependent origination is the knowledge of cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pas ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de ni lam shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pas ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de ni lam shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the path is the discernment that the truth of the path is also dependently arisen, and so is not essentially produced or stopped.

original: de ltar na chos shes pas skad cig gcig la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas sngon ma mthong ba'i blta bar bya ba gzhan mi srid do //
analyzed: de ltar na chos shes pas skad cig gcig la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas sngon ma mthong ba'i blta bar bya ba gzhan mi srid do //
translated: Thus, by the knowledge of dharmas, in one moment, one sees dependent arising, and it is impossible that there is another object to be seen that was not seen before.

original: gal te de ltar na mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bco lngar ji ltar gzhag //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bco lngar ji ltar gzhag //
translated: If that is so, how can the path of seeing be posited as fifteen moments?

original: sde pa kha cig ni mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bco lngar mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: sde pa kha cig ni mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bco lngar mi 'dod kyi /
translated: Some schools do not assert that the path of seeing is fifteen moments.

original: mngon par rtogs pa gcig tu zad par 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa gcig tu zad par 'dod do //
translated: They assert that it is a single clear realization.

original: de dag gi 'dod pa dang bshad pa 'di mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dod pa dang bshad pa 'di mi 'gal lo //
translated: There is no contradiction between their assertion and this explanation.

original: gang dag skad cig ma bco lngar 'dod pa de dag gi ltar yang de lta bus gdul ba'i skye bo la de bstan pas phan gdags pa'i phyir shes pa ngo bo gcig la char phye ste /
analyzed: gang dag skad cig ma bco lngar 'dod pa de dag gi ltar yang de lta bus gdul ba'i skye bo la de bstan pas phan gdags pa'i phyir shes pa ngo bo gcig la char phye ste /
translated: According to those who assert fifteen moments, the path of seeing is also posited as fifteen moments because it benefits those to be guided by teaching them that way.

original: cha bco lngar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: cha bco lngar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The path of meditation is posited as sixteen aspects.üîΩIf that is so, then how is the path of meditation posited as sixteen aspects?

original: gal te de ltar na lam sgom pa rnam pa bcu drug pa de ci lta bur thar par 'dod pa rnams lam rnams pa gzhan dag gis de kho na shes pa la 'jug pa goms par bya ba'i phyir 'di yang yongs su brtags nas rnam par gzhag pa
analyzed: gal te de ltar na lam sgom pa rnam pa bcu drug pa de ci lta bur thar par 'dod pa rnams lam rnams pa gzhan dag gis de kho na shes pa la 'jug pa goms par bya ba'i phyir 'di yang yongs su brtags nas rnam par gzhag pa
translated: Those who assert liberation by other paths are familiar with the knowledge of thatness through other paths.

original: nyid de / de kho na ni ngo bo gcig bur zad do //
analyzed: nyid de / de kho na ni ngo bo gcig bur zad do //
translated: Thatness is just a single entity.

original: ci ste khyad par du dbye ba'i rnam pa dngos po gzhan shes pa gzhan gyis gzung ba zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: ci ste khyad par du dbye ba'i rnam pa dngos po gzhan shes pa gzhan gyis gzung ba zhig yod na ni /
translated: If the aspect that is differentiated is apprehended by another consciousness that is a different entity,

original: de'i tshe rnam pa yongs su ma bcad pa yongs su bcad dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam pa yongs su ma bcad pa yongs su bcad dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time the unapprehended aspect must be apprehended.

original: chos shes pa de'i 'og tu bye brag tu yongs su gcad par bya ba bye brag dbye ba zhig yod na ni de'i dmigs pa gzhan du brtags pas nges de'i ngo bo bye brag tu yongs su gcad dgos pas mi mkhas pa sus dngos po shin tu phra
analyzed: chos shes pa de'i 'og tu bye brag tu yongs su gcad par bya ba bye brag dbye ba zhig yod na ni de'i dmigs pa gzhan du brtags pas nges de'i ngo bo bye brag tu yongs su gcad dgos pas mi mkhas pa sus dngos po shin tu phra
translated: Since one must thoroughly differentiate its nature, what wise person would imagine that a very subtle thing arises by virtue of its own nature?

original: ba la rang gi ngo bor skye bar rnam par brtags pas kyang rten @13b cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med cing ro gcig pa'i don mi shes pa yin na rags pa sa la sogs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: ba la rang gi ngo bor skye bar rnam par brtags pas kyang rten @13b cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med cing ro gcig pa'i don mi shes pa yin na rags pa sa la sogs pa lta ci smos /
translated: If even one who is not learned does not understand the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of the absence of intrinsic arising and the meaning of a single taste, what need is there to mention the coarse, such as earth and so on?

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don de mtshan nyid gcig tu mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don de mtshan nyid gcig tu mthong ste /
translated: Thus one sees the meaning of dependent origination as a single characteristic.

original: rim gyis goms par byas nas ma rig pa ma lus par 'gags te /
analyzed: rim gyis goms par byas nas ma rig pa ma lus par 'gags te /
translated: Having gradually become accustomed to that, one completely stops ignorance.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid la dmigs pa'i shes pa la gnas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa dang bya ba byas pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ste gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid la dmigs pa'i shes pa la gnas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa dang bya ba byas pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ste gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: One who abides in the consciousness that observes the reality of dependent origination is said to be ‚Äúone who has attained nirvana in this life‚Äù and ‚Äúone who has done what is to be done,‚Äù but not otherwise.

original: ci ste khyod kyi gzhung ltar na /
analyzed: ci ste khyod kyi gzhung ltar na /
translated: If, according to your scriptures,üîΩThe monk who has exhausted the afflictions

original: nyon mongs zad pa'i dge slong gi /'khor ba gal te rnam bzlog na //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad pa'i dge slong gi /'khor ba gal te rnam bzlog na //
translated: Reverses the cycle of existence,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang //
translated: Why do the perfect buddhas

original: ci phyir de yi rtsom mi bzad //
analyzed: ci phyir de yi rtsom mi bzad //
translated: Not reverse it?

original: gal te ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa bzlog na las ldog ste /
analyzed: gal te ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa bzlog na las ldog ste /
translated: If the afflictions are reversed by wisdom, karma is reversed.

original: rgyu dang rkyen du mi ldan pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nas 'khor bar 'jug pa dang skye ba dang 'chi ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud ba rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyun ldog na de lta na ni de rtsom
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen du mi ldan pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nas 'khor bar 'jug pa dang skye ba dang 'chi ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud ba rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyun ldog na de lta na ni de rtsom
translated: If the continuum of form and so on, which has existed in cyclic existence since beginningless time, is reversed through the power of wisdom, then the composition of that continuum would be reversed.

original: pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma gsungs pa ni gtan tshigs 'di lta bu zhig gis bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsom pa ma gsungs so //
analyzed: pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma gsungs pa ni gtan tshigs 'di lta bu zhig gis bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsom pa ma gsungs so //
translated: because the Transcendent Lord has not taught the beginning of the continuum of the aggregates.

original: zhes 'di la khyod kyi phung po'i rgyun de'i rtsom pa tha ma bzhin du brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'di la khyod kyi phung po'i rgyun de'i rtsom pa tha ma bzhin du brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: You must state the beginning of the continuum of the aggregates as the beginning of this continuum.

original: mi mkhyen te ma gsungs sam gzhan zhig gi phyir ma gsungs zhes bya /
analyzed: mi mkhyen te ma gsungs sam gzhan zhig gi phyir ma gsungs zhes bya /
translated: Do you say that he does not know and therefore has not taught, or that he has not taught for some other reason?

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen par khas len pa'i phyir mi mkhyen ni mi srid do /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen par khas len pa'i phyir mi mkhyen ni mi srid do /
translated: In this case, it is impossible that he does not know because he is accepted as omniscient.

original: gzhan zhig gi phyir ma gsungs zhes byar ni de yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan zhig gi phyir ma gsungs zhes byar ni de yang mi rigs so //
translated: If you say that he has not taught for some other reason, that is also illogical.

original: zo chun brgyud mo'i 'khrul 'khor ltar thog ma med pa'i phyir ma gsungs zhes byar ni gal te de ltar na zo chun brgyud mo'i 'khrul 'khor ltar thog ma med pa de bzhin du de'i tha ma yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zo chun brgyud mo'i 'khrul 'khor ltar thog ma med pa'i phyir ma gsungs zhes byar ni gal te de ltar na zo chun brgyud mo'i 'khrul 'khor ltar thog ma med pa de bzhin du de'i tha ma yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that he has not taught because it is like a waterwheel that has no beginning, then if it is so, it would be like a waterwheel that has no beginning, and it would also have no end.

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i dpe la yang de skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i dpe la yang de skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same argument applies to the examples of the wheel, etc.

original: zad par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas tha ma yod pa skad bya na ni de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mi mkhyen pa yod par 'gyur te /üîΩmi mkhyen mi srid pas rtsom pa yang bstan dgos so //
analyzed: zad par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas tha ma yod pa skad bya na ni de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mi mkhyen pa yod par 'gyur te / mi mkhyen mi srid pas rtsom pa yang bstan dgos so //
translated: If you say that the last moment of consciousness has a cause, then the Blessed One, the Buddha, would not be omniscient,üîΩbecause he would not know the first moment of consciousness.

original: ma bstan na yang rigs pa 'di dang sbyang na med du mi rung ste @14a * //
analyzed: ma bstan na yang rigs pa 'di dang sbyang na med du mi rung ste @14a * //
translated: And if he does not know it, then this reasoning is not established.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rtsoms yod na nges par yod //
analyzed: rtsoms yod na nges par yod //
translated: if there is a beginning, there is a definite beginning.

original: lta bar gyur pa yongs su 'dzin //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa yongs su 'dzin //
translated: One would hold a view.

original: rtsom pa yod par brtag na ni //
analyzed: rtsom pa yod par brtag na ni //
translated: If one imagines that there is a beginning,

original: 'khor ba thog ma can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma can du 'gyur ro //
translated: samsara would have a beginning.

original: thog ma yod pa can du gyur na ni rgyu med par smra ba khas blangs pas log par lta ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog ma yod pa can du gyur na ni rgyu med par smra ba khas blangs pas log par lta ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it had a beginning, one would be advocating the doctrine of causelessness, and so one would be holding a wrong view.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba la ni nyes pa 'di med do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba la ni nyes pa 'di med do //
translated: But for one who advocates dependent origination, this fault does not arise.

original: su dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'dod pa de ni de dag ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes par 'dod pas de dag gi thog ma'am tha ma med pas yongs su brtag pa mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: su dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'dod pa de ni de dag ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes par 'dod pas de dag gi thog ma'am tha ma med pas yongs su brtag pa mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, it says:

original: rten cing 'brel par gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par gang 'byung ba //
translated: What has arisen dependently

original: de la sngon dang tha ma ci //
analyzed: de la sngon dang tha ma ci //
translated: has no beginning and no end.

original: zhes bya ba smos te gdon mi za bar 'di nyid khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te gdon mi za bar 'di nyid khas blangs dgos so //
translated: Undoubtedly, this must be accepted.

original: gzhan du na ni 'khor ba thog ma can du 'gyur bar yang ma zad de /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni 'khor ba thog ma can du 'gyur bar yang ma zad de /
translated: Otherwise, not only would cyclic existence have a beginning,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis skyes pa na gzhan du 'gyur mi srid pas rtag pa kho nar gyur par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis skyes pa na gzhan du 'gyur mi srid pas rtag pa kho nar gyur par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but also since it is impossible for what is intrinsically produced to transform into something else, it would have to be permanent. To demonstrate this, it says:

original: sngon skyes pa ni ji lta bur //
analyzed: sngon skyes pa ni ji lta bur //
translated: How could what was produced before

original: phyi nas rab tu ldog par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: phyi nas rab tu ldog par 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: later be reversed?

original: ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur bas rtag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur bas rtag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is saying that since its essence would not change, it would be permanent.

original: dngos po skye ba de'i rang bzhin med pa las 'byung ba khas len na ni /
analyzed: dngos po skye ba de'i rang bzhin med pa las 'byung ba khas len na ni /
translated: If you accept that things arise from a nature that is not existent,

original: rtsom pa yod na nges par yang //
analyzed: rtsom pa yod na nges par yang //
translated: then, if there is a beginning,

original: lta bar gyur pa yongs su 'dzin /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa yongs su 'dzin /
translated: you will certainly hold a view.

original: med pa las dngos po rnams rkyen mi rgyu med pa kho na las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa las dngos po rnams rkyen mi rgyu med pa kho na las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Things would arise from a non-existent cause, without conditions and without a reason.

original: de bas na rgyu med par lta ba de yang de bzhin du yod la de yang 'brel na ni chad par lta ba'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu med par lta ba de yang de bzhin du yod la de yang 'brel na ni chad par lta ba'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the view of causelessness is also like that. If you are connected to it, you will have the fault of the view of nihilism.

original: nam zhig 'di la rten cing 'brel par gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: nam zhig 'di la rten cing 'brel par gang 'byung ba //
translated: When something arises in dependence and connection,

original: de la sngon dang tha ma ci //
analyzed: de la sngon dang tha ma ci //
translated: what is its beginning and end?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not essentially arisen.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Thus, because it arises in dependence and connection, it is not essentially arisen.

original: des na the tshom med par /
analyzed: des na the tshom med par /
translated: Therefore, without doubt,

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' spangs pas //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' spangs pas //
translated: because the beginning and end are abandoned,

original: 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang //
translated: the world appears like an illusion.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma sgrub pa'i sngags kyi sbyor ba las glang po che dang rta dang mi la sogs pa byung ba rnams ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes na glang po che la sogs par snang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma sgrub pa'i sngags kyi sbyor ba las glang po che dang rta dang mi la sogs pa byung ba rnams ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes na glang po che la sogs par snang ste /
translated: Just as the illusionist conjures up an elephant, a horse, a man, etc. by the power of his mantra, and they appear as elephants, etc. but are not really born,

analyzed: de dag la glang po che yang dag pa la sogs pa ltar sngon dang tha ma'i rtog pa mi 'byung ba de bzhin du glang po che yang dag pa la sogs par 'dod pa rnams kyang rten cing @14b 'brel par 'byung bas sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar brtag

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyi sngags kyi rkyen las byung ba'i bud med na chung sgyu thabs rnams legs par bslabs pa lta bu dbyibs dang spyod lam shin tu mdzes pa tshul shin tu mdzes shing gzhogs stegs la mkhas pa phun sum tshogs pa yid 'phrog pa dag

analyzed: de la ji ltar mi mkhas pa dag rnam par rtog pa ltar rang bzhin med de de'i ngo bo nyid la mkhas pa sgyu ma mkhan ni sgyu ma yang dag pa ma yin par snang ba khong du chud pas de ltar yang rmongs pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo

analyzed: rnal 'byor pas srid pa 'dus byas ma lus pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu ba lta bur blo yang dag pa'i bsam pa so so rang gi shes rab kyis mthong na don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du gang yang mi dmigs pas dngos po'i rang bzhin gang yin
translated: When the yogi sees with his mind, which is the correct thought of wisdom that is individually realized, that all of existence is like an illusion or a mirage, he does not observe anything as an ultimate nature. Thus, whatever is the nature of things

analyzed: 'gro ba shin tu mi shes so //

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid skye //

analyzed: rang bzhin du ni gang ma skyes //

analyzed: de ni skyes zhes ji skad bya // zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: de dang de zhes bya ba spyir bsnyag pa thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir tshig 'dis nang gi ma rig pa la sogs pa dang phyi'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ma lus pa dag 'du byed la sogs pa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa skye ba la rgyu'i dngos por gnas par gyur te /
translated: This verse shows that internal ignorance and so on and external wind mandalas and so on are the causes of the production of internal formations and so on and external water mandalas and so on.

original: rgyu de dang de la brten nas gang skye ba de gal te rang gi ngo bos grub pa zhig yin na ni de yod par gyur pas grub pa'i ngo bo'i dus bzhin du skye ba'i rgyal mi ltos par 'gyur ro //

translated: If that which arises in dependence on those causes existed essentially, then, since it would exist, it would arise without depending on the causes of its arising, just as it does when it has already arisen and exists.

analyzed: ci ste skye ba de sngon rang gi ngo bo med na ni skyes pa de yang gzugs brnyan bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin par mngon pas //
translated: But if that arising did not exist previously by virtue of its own nature, then that which has arisen would not exist inherently, just like a reflected image.

original: de dang de brten gang byung ba //
analyzed: de dang de brten gang byung ba //
translated: That which arises in dependence on that and that

analyzed: rang bzhin du ni de ma skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: mkhas pas ni gzu bo lta bu'i blos rnam par dpyad pa'i rigs pa snyam /

original: rang bzhin du ni gang ma skyes //
analyzed: rang bzhin du ni gang ma skyes //

analyzed: de ni skyes zhes ji skad bya //

analyzed: sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni phra ba ste /

analyzed: gal te de rang gi mtshan nyid du @15b ma skyes par sems na de gsher ba'i mtshan nyid du skyes sa zhes brtag tu ni mi rung na /
translated: If you think that it does not arise by virtue of its intrinsic identity, then it would be incorrect to call it ‚Äúarisen‚Äù in terms of its identity as wetness.

analyzed: de gzhan gang ci zhig tu skye bar brtag / de bas na bdag dang gzhan las skye mi srid pas skye ba med grub bo //
translated: So what else could it be said to have arisen? Therefore, since it is impossible for it to arise from itself or from another, it is established that it does not arise.

analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skye ba mi srid pa ci bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown that arising is impossible in the context of dependent origination, Candrakƒ´rti says:

analyzed: da ni 'gag pa mi srid par bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: it is said:

analyzed: rgyu zad pa yis zhi ba ni //

analyzed: zad ces bya bar mngon pa ste // rang bzhin du ni gang ma zad //

original: de la zad ces ji skad brjod //
analyzed: de la zad ces ji skad brjod //

analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //

analyzed: skyes pa'i dngos po skye ba yod na 'jig la dngos po'i gnas pa yang rkyen gyi khan las te gnas pa'i rkyen med na 'jig par 'gyur bas de ltar na 'jig rten na rgyu zad nas zhi ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de nyid
translated: If the entity of arising existed, there would be destruction. The endurance of an entity also depends on conditions. Since it would be destroyed if there were no conditions for endurance, in that case, peace and nirvana in the world are

analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya bar dmigs te /

analyzed: gang yang gnas pa'i rkyen med na zad par 'gyur ba de gnas pa'i rkyen med pa la rag las pas rang gi ngo bor grub pa med par khong du chud nas / rang bzhin gyis ni gang ma zad //
translated: Moreover, since that which would be exhausted in the absence of conditions for endurance depends on the absence of conditions for endurance, it should be understood that it does not exist as an established entity.

original: de la zad ces ji skad brjod //
analyzed: de la zad ces ji skad brjod //
translated: How can that which is not exhausted by nature

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: be called exhausted?

analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis zad pa zhig yod na ni de rkyen la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were cessation by way of intrinsic nature, then it would not depend on conditions.

original: de rgyu yongs su zad pa las ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rgyu yongs su zad pa las ma yin par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa'i dngos po med par ma gyur kyang mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de bas na 'bad mi dgos par thar bar 'gyur ro //

translated: It would be logical that the butterlamp would go out without the exhaustion of the butter and wick, but that is not the case. Therefore, cessation is not established by way of its own nature.

analyzed: ci ste mar dang ras yongs su zad pa ni mar me'i 'chi ba'i rgyu ma yin te /

translated: The butter and the wick are stopped together, but the last moment of the lamp is not the homogeneous cause of the future moment of the lamp, because it is stopped.

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang skye ba'i rkyen med pas ma skyes te /
translated: And the future moment is not born, because it does not have the condition of birth.

translated: Thus, since the future does not have a condition, it is said to be unborn.

original: na gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that way, then the future, which does not have a condition, would be the cause of non-arising. But if it did not lack a condition, it would certainly arise.

original: de ltar na mi skye ba yang rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa yin no de ltar khas len na rgyu zad nas zhi ba gang yin pa de zad pa zhes bya bar khas blangs pa yin no //

translated: Thus, non-arising would also be accepted as a cause. If you accept that, then you accept that what is peaceful due to the exhaustion of causes is exhausted.

analyzed: gang dag dngos po rnams kyi 'gag pa rgyu med pa yin par 'dzin pa de dag gi 'gag pa de dngos po la brten par mi 'gyur te /
translated: For those who hold that the cessation of things is causeless, that cessation would not depend on things,

analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be without a cause, like a sky flower and so on.

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i phyir rdza ma la sogs pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin na de dag kyang dngos po la brten pas de bas na de dag gcig tu nges pa med do zhe na yang /

translated: If, because of the nonexistence of things, such things as pots are not dependently arisen, then because they depend on things, they are not definitely one.

analyzed: 'jig rten na rgyu dang bcas pa grags pas de dag ltar ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so, because in the world, they are known to have causes.

analyzed: yang na de dag kyang 'gag pa bzhin du dngos po la brten pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te med pa la rgyu zhes ji skad du bya zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow can a non-existent be a cause?‚Äù

original: yod pa las yang rgyu zhes ji skad du bya ;
analyzed: yod pa las yang rgyu zhes ji skad du bya ;

original: dngos la mkhas pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: dngos la mkhas pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: Those who are skilled in the facts

original: @18a * // dngos po mi rtag slu ba'i chos //
analyzed: @18a * // dngos po mi rtag slu ba'i chos //
translated: see that things are impermanent and deceptive,üîΩempty, insubstantial,

original: gsog dang stong ba bdag med pa //üîΩrnam par dben par rab tu mthong //
analyzed: gsog dang stong ba bdag med pa // rnam par dben par rab tu mthong //
translated: and void.

original: byung bas dngos po zhes bya ste //
analyzed: byung bas dngos po zhes bya ste //

original: dngos po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dus pa la bya'o /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dus pa la bya'o /

analyzed: dngos po de yang skad cig re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pas mi rtag pa'o //
translated: And since things are momentary, they are impermanent.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ngo bo nyid med pa yin na gang gi phyir byis pa rnams la ngo bo nyid yod par snang ba de'i phyir sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du slu bas na dngos po de nyid slu ba'i chos so //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ngo bo nyid med pa yin na gang gi phyir byis pa rnams la ngo bo nyid yod par snang ba de'i phyir sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du slu bas na dngos po de nyid slu ba'i chos so //
translated: If the nature of things is essenceless, then because they appear to fools as if they had essences, they are deceptive, like illusions, etc. Therefore, things are deceptive phenomena.

original: ring du gnas pa'i mthu med la rang bzhin gyis nyam chung bas gsog go //
analyzed: ring du gnas pa'i mthu med la rang bzhin gyis nyam chung bas gsog go //

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: They are empty because they are essenceless.

original: bdag gis stong pa'i phyir bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis stong pa'i phyir bdag med pa ste /
translated: They are selfless because they are empty of self.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bsnyad do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bsnyad do //
translated: Impermanence, etc. are described as the nature of things.

original: de bas na dngos po 'di de ltar mthong bas mkhas pa de dag gis dben par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po 'di de ltar mthong bas mkhas pa de dag gis dben par mthong ngo //

original: dben zhes bya ba ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: dben zhes bya ba ni stong pa'o //
