original: de ltar na dben pa mthun pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i dgon pa rnams la dben pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dben pa mthun pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i dgon pa rnams la dben pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, because they are consistent with emptiness, the abodes of the unborn are called ‚Äúempty.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rnal 'byor pas dngos po dben par mthong zhes bya ba ni stong par mthong ba'i bar la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rnal 'byor pas dngos po dben par mthong zhes bya ba ni stong par mthong ba'i bar la bya'o //
translated: In the same way, here, the yogi sees things as empty should be understood as seeing things as void.

original: de dag dngos po nyid skur te dben par mthong ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag dngos po nyid skur te dben par mthong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: They do not see things as void, having made them void.

original: dngos po stong par gyur pa la stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po stong par gyur pa la stong par mthong ngo //
translated: They see things as void, having made them void.

original: stong pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa bye brag rnams smos so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa bye brag rnams smos so //
translated: The various aspects such as impermanence are mentioned in order to teach emptiness.

original: yang na dben pa ni dri ma med pa yin na 'di ltar so so'i skye bo rnams phyin ci log tu gyur ba rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i dngos po yang rang gi rtog pa'i 'dri mas sbags pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu khong du chud kyi
analyzed: yang na dben pa ni dri ma med pa yin na 'di ltar so so'i skye bo rnams phyin ci log tu gyur ba rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i dngos po yang rang gi rtog pa'i 'dri mas sbags pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu khong du chud kyi
translated: Or else, voidness is stainless, and thus ordinary beings, who are mistaken, understand things that are naturally pure as defiled by the stains of their own concepts.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the noble ones are not like that.

original: de dag ni med pa la sgro mi 'dogs par dben par dri ma med pa nyid du gzigs so //
analyzed: de dag ni med pa la sgro mi 'dogs par dben par dri ma med pa nyid du gzigs so //
translated: They see voidness as stainless, not superimposing nonexistence.

original: yang na 'phags pa rnams de kho na'i ye shes las bzhengs nas dngos po la gzigs na dben par gzigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa rnams de kho na'i ye shes las bzhengs nas dngos po la gzigs na dben par gzigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, when the noble ones rise from the gnosis of reality, if they see things, it is said that they see them as empty.

analyzed: 'phags pa mdzad pa mthar phyin pa nyi tshes 'di ltar gzigs par yang ma zad de /

original: slob dpon yang rang gi shes pa la brten nas /
analyzed: slob dpon yang rang gi shes pa la brten nas /
translated: The master, too, on the basis of his own knowledge,

analyzed: rigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos nyid rab rtogs pas chos nyid la gces @18b par 'dzin pa yang dag par skyes te /
translated: has perfectly generated the appreciation of reality through his full understanding of reality together with the reasoning.

original: rang gis rigs pa ston pa na //üîΩgnas med dmigs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rang gis rigs pa ston pa na // gnas med dmigs pa yod ma yin //
translated: When he teaches the reasoning,üîΩhe says:üîΩThere is no locus, there is no object,

original: rtsa ba med cing gnas pa med //
analyzed: rtsa ba med cing gnas pa med //
translated: no root, and no location.

original: ma rigs rgyu las shin tu byung //
analyzed: ma rigs rgyu las shin tu byung //
translated: It arises from an unreal cause.

original: thog ma dbus mtha' rnam par spangs //
analyzed: thog ma dbus mtha' rnam par spangs //
translated: It is devoid of beginning, middle, and end.

original: chu shing bzhin du snying po med //
analyzed: chu shing bzhin du snying po med //
translated: It is without essence, like a plantain tree.

original: dri za'i grong khyer 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer 'dra ba ste //
translated: It is like a city of gandharvas.

original: rmongs pa'i grong khyer mi bzad pa //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i grong khyer mi bzad pa //
translated: It is the unbearable city of the ignorant.

original: 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It appears like an illusion.

original: 'di la brten bsag nas te /üîΩlo tog rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di la brten bsag nas te / lo tog rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa //
translated: The root of the world is the primary cause of the world. It is the cause of the origination of those things that arise from it, and it is the cause of their increase.

original: sa gzhi bzhin du gzhi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi bzhin du gzhi byed pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like the root of a tree.

original: 'di'i gnas med pas gnas med pa'o //üîΩbrten par bya bas dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i gnas med pas gnas med pa'o // brten par bya bas dmigs pa ste /
translated: Since there is no basis, there is no basis.

analyzed: ldang mi nus pa rnams ldang bar byed pa'i 'khor ba bzhin no //
translated: The object is that which is to be relied upon, like the world for those who are unable to rise up.

original: 'di'i dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no object, there is no object.

original: rtsa ba ni rgyu'i gtso bo ste de yang de las 'byung ba rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'das pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba ni rgyu'i gtso bo ste de yang de las 'byung ba rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'das pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The root is the primary cause of the world. It is the cause of the origination of those things that arise from it, and it is the cause of their increase.

original: dper na / shing rnams kyi rtsa ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na / shing rnams kyi rtsa ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the root of a tree.

original: gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no basis, there is no basis.

original: gnas pa dang dmigs pa dang skye ba'i rgyu dang gnas pa med pa 'dis 'gro ba ma grub pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: gnas pa dang dmigs pa dang skye ba'i rgyu dang gnas pa med pa 'dis 'gro ba ma grub pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: By these causes of basis, object, origination, and non-basis, it is said that the world is not established.

analyzed: de dag ni dngos po rnams 'grub pa'i rgyu yin na de dag kyang 'gro ba med pas /

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba ni log pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba ni log pa'o //

original: de la gnas ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: de la gnas ni skye mched drug go //

original: dmigs pa ni chos thams cad de mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni chos thams cad de mthun mthun du sbyar ro //

original: rtsa ba ni sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: The root is the causal condition, in the manner of the seed-dharma.

original: 'dis gnas par byed pas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis gnas par byed pas gnas pa ste /

original: des skyes pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des skyes pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the arising of that, abiding.

original: de dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: All of these are dependently arisen and thus lack intrinsic reality.üîΩAs was taught above:

original: de dang de brten gang byung ba //
analyzed: de dang de brten gang byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on this

original: rang gi dngos por de ma skyes //üîΩzhes gong du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi dngos por de ma skyes // zhes gong du bstan pa yin no //
translated: and that does not arise by its own nature.

original: de'i phyir gnas la sogs pa dang bral ba'i 'gro ba ni yod par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas la sogs pa dang bral ba'i 'gro ba ni yod par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, a world that is free from basis and so on is not tenable.

original: gal te de ltar 'gro ba med na ji ltar de'i rang gi ngo bo rnam pa sna tshogs su dmigs zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'gro ba med na ji ltar de'i rang gi ngo bo rnam pa sna tshogs su dmigs zhe na ;
translated: If there is no world in this way, how is it that its various aspects are observed?

analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su mi dmigs te /
translated: The noble ones do not observe the world in various aspects.

analyzed: de dag la 'gro ba stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas stong pa nyid la rnam pa sna tshogs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since they are of one taste in emptiness, emptiness does not have various aspects.

original: de bas na byis pa ma rig pa'i gnyid kyis log pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ni ma sad de rmi lam rmi @19a * //
analyzed: de bas na byis pa ma rig pa'i gnyid kyis log pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ni ma sad de rmi lam rmi @19a * //
translated: Therefore, the childish, who are asleep in the sleep of ignorance, are deluded. They are taught to be like those who dream of various things while asleep.

original: pa bzhin du sna tshogs su dmigs par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩma rig rgyu las shin byung //
analyzed: pa bzhin du sna tshogs su dmigs par bstan pa'i phyir / ma rig rgyu las shin byung //
translated: To explain this, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The world arises from the cause of ignorance.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa med pa dang / ma rig pa yod pas 'gro ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa med pa dang / ma rig pa yod pas 'gro ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub ste /
translated: Since there is no intrinsic existence and there is ignorance, the world has no intrinsic existence.

original: ma rig pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu las gyur pa nges so ;
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu las gyur pa nges so ;
translated: It is certain that it arises from the cause of the seed of ignorance.

original: / ji ltar ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / ji ltar ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /

original: thog ma dbus mtha' rnam par spangs //
analyzed: thog ma dbus mtha' rnam par spangs //
translated: It is devoid of beginning, middle, and end.

original: zhes bya ba ston te skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ston te skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: 'di'i phyir yang ma rig pa'i sa bon las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang ma rig pa'i sa bon las byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it arises from the seed of nescience.

analyzed: 'di ltar chu shing bzhin du snying po med pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is without a core, like a plantain tree.

original: gal te ma rig pa'i sa bon las byung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa'i sa bon las byung ba ma yin na /
translated: If it did not arise from the seed of nescience,

analyzed: de'i tshe brtags na snying po dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rigs na 'dus byas ni brtags na chu shing gi phung po bzhin du snying po med do //
translated: then, when examined, it would be reasonable that a core would be found. But, when examined, compounded things are without a core, like a pile of ka·π≠hina grass.

original: gang snying po med kyang snying po can du snang ba de gti mug gi mthu las byung ba ste ;
analyzed: gang snying po med kyang snying po can du snang ba de gti mug gi mthu las byung ba ste ;
translated: That which appears to have a core, although it is without a core, arises from the power of delusion.

original: de ltar na 'gro ba ni ma rig pa'i sa bon las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'gro ba ni ma rig pa'i sa bon las byung ba'o //
translated: Thus, the world arises from the seed of nescience.

original: 'di'i phyir yang ma rig pa'i sa bon las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang ma rig pa'i sa bon las byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it arises from the seed of nescience.

original: 'di ltar dri za'i grong khyer lta bu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dri za'i grong khyer lta bu yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'di ltar dri za'i grong khyer yang dag pa bzhin du snang yang brtags na de bzhin ma yin pas grong khyer yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: A gandharva city appears to be real, but, when examined, it is not so. Thus, a city is not real.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar brtags nam rig pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i 'gro ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub pa de'i phyir ;'di ni nges par rmongs pa'i grong khyer mi bzad pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar brtags nam rig pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i 'gro ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub pa de'i phyir ;'di ni nges par rmongs pa'i grong khyer mi bzad pa /

original: 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang //
translated: The world appears like an illusion.

original: gnod par byed pa bzlog par dka' ba dang / mun pas bsgribs pas rang gi ngo bo rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa bzlog par dka' ba dang / mun pas bsgribs pas rang gi ngo bo rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is difficult to stop the harm done by the darkness of ignorance, which obscures the world and makes it difficult to understand its nature,

original: 'gro ba mi bzad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba mi bzad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is called ‚Äúthe unbearable world.‚Äù

original: ma rungs pa dang dbugs 'byin pa med pa'i gnas dang 'jigs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma rungs pa dang dbugs 'byin pa med pa'i gnas dang 'jigs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de'i phyir 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa rnams kyis sgyu ma bzhin du gzigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa rnams kyis sgyu ma bzhin du gzigs so //
translated: Therefore, the non-erroneous see it as like an illusion.

analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi rmongs pa'i grong khyer gang yin pa de 'phags pa rnams kyis sgyu ma bzhin du gzigs te /

original: ma rig pa'i mun par dang  phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun par dang  phyir ro //
translated: because it is obscured by the darkness of ignorance.

original: 'di'i phyir yang dang ltar 'gro ba de dngos po med de 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang dang ltar 'gro ba de dngos po med de 'di ltar /
translated: For this reason, the going of the goer is not a thing.

analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs 'jig rten 'di // bden par rab tu gang brjod pa //
translated: Brahma and so on are said in the worldüîΩTo be valid cognizers with regard to this world.

original: 'phags la @19b de yang brdzun zhes gsungs //
analyzed: 'phags la @19b de yang brdzun zhes gsungs //
translated: But the Subduer has said that even they are false for the noble ones.

original: de las gzhan na ci zhig lus //
analyzed: de las gzhan na ci zhig lus //

analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur ma gyur pa gang yang yod dam zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //

analyzed: dbang po yul las 'das pa'i don yongs su gcod pa ni 'jig rten na tshangs pa ni tshad ma'o //
translated: In the world, Brahma is a valid cognizer with regard to the objects that are beyond the senses.üîΩThe Subduer has taught that even the appearance of the true essence of things to that valid cognizer is false for the noble ones.

original: de ltar tshad mar gyur pa de la dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo bden par snang ba gang yin pa de yang 'phags pa rnams la brdzun no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das ba nyid bden pa gcig pu'o //üîΩzhes bstan pa ni gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar tshad mar gyur pa de la dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo bden par snang ba gang yin pa de yang 'phags pa rnams la brdzun no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das ba nyid bden pa gcig pu'o //üîΩzhes bstan pa ni gsungs te /
translated: He has taught that nirvana alone is the truth.

original: 'dus byas ni brdzun bslu ba'i chos can yin na gzhan dag la snang ba gang yin pa de brdzun par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni brdzun bslu ba'i chos can yin na gzhan dag la snang ba gang yin pa de brdzun par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: If conditioned things are false and deceptive, why wouldn‚Äôt what appears to others be false?

original: gang la brdzun pa nyid du the tshom med pa de las gzhan ci zhig lus zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bur ma gyur pa gang yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang la brdzun pa nyid du the tshom med pa de las gzhan ci zhig lus zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bur ma gyur pa gang yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What else remains that is not false? This means that there is nothing that is not like an illusion.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blangs bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blangs bar bya'o //

analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa zhes bya ba na ni de @27a * //
translated: If it is called ‚Äúnon-arisen,‚Äù

original: brten nas skyes pa zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: brten nas skyes pa zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable to say that it is produced in dependence.

original: de bas na nang 'gal ba'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: de bas na nang 'gal ba'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: Therefore, because of internal contradiction, this is not reasonable.

original: kye ma kyi hud rna ba dang snying med pas kyang bdag la klan ka btsal ba gang yin pa de ni bdag ma rungs pa zhes bab bo //üîΩgang brten nas skyes pa de gzugs brnyan bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis skyes pa ma yin no zhes kho bos gang gi tshe smras pa de'i tshe de la klan ka btsal ba'i skabs ga la yod /
analyzed: kye ma kyi hud rna ba dang snying med pas kyang bdag la klan ka btsal ba gang yin pa de ni bdag ma rungs pa zhes bab bo // gang brten nas skyes pa de gzugs brnyan bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis skyes pa ma yin no zhes kho bos gang gi tshe smras pa de'i tshe de la klan ka btsal ba'i skabs ga la yod /
translated: Alas! Alas! You have accused me of being a bad person, even though you have no ears or heart.üîΩWhen I say that what is produced in dependence is not essentially produced, like a reflection, then how can you accuse me?

original: brten nas 'byung ba'i rnam pa gang gi gzugs brnyan dmigs pa de'i brdzun par gyur pa dmigs pa kho bo ma skyes pa'o zhes smra'i ;
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba'i rnam pa gang gi gzugs brnyan dmigs pa de'i brdzun par gyur pa dmigs pa kho bo ma skyes pa'o zhes smra'i ;
translated: I say that the dependent origination of the image that is observed is observed as false, and that it is not produced.

original: bdag nyid gang gis de'i byung ba med pa rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyis de'i skye ba med par brjod do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis de'i byung ba med pa rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyis de'i skye ba med par brjod do //
translated: By the very fact that its occurrence is not established, its production is said to be nonexistent.

original: bdag nyid gang gis de'i skye ba med par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis de'i skye ba med par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: By what fact is its nonproduction established?

original: yang dag par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'dod kyi /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'dod kyi /
translated: It is asserted to be real in the sense of being real by nature,

original: brdzun pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brdzun pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in the sense of being unreal by nature,

original: de ni ngo bo des rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo des rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that it arises dependently by nature.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba dang mi skye ba 'di gnyis yul ma yin pa'i phyir gcig gi yul du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba dang mi skye ba 'di gnyis yul ma yin pa'i phyir gcig gi yul du ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since arising and non-arising are not the objects of a single cognition, how could they be the objects of a single cognition?

original: gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji ltar dmigs pa de la skye ba med pa zhes mi ston gyi /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji ltar dmigs pa de la skye ba med pa zhes mi ston gyi /
translated: If you say that you do not teach that dependent origination is non-arisen in the sense that it is not observed,

original: ngo bo nyid la skye ba med pa zhes ston na 'di la khyod kyis de skad smras pa lta bu sngon ma thos pa ci zhig bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la skye ba med pa zhes ston na 'di la khyod kyis de skad smras pa lta bu sngon ma thos pa ci zhig bstan par 'gyur /
translated: but that it is non-arisen by nature, then what previously unheard teaching do you teach here, as if it were something new?

original: kho bo ni sngon ma thos pa cung zad kyang mi ston te /
analyzed: kho bo ni sngon ma thos pa cung zad kyang mi ston te /
translated: We do not teach anything previously unheard.

original: nged kyi bstan bcos ni ji ltar gnas pa'i chos nyid bstan pa ched che bar bya ba yin na ji ltar gnas pa'i chos nyid de la yang phyin ci log gi rjes su 'brang ba 'dren po phyogs bslad pa lta bu dag rnam pa gzhan du yongs su
analyzed: nged kyi bstan bcos ni ji ltar gnas pa'i chos nyid bstan pa ched che bar bya ba yin na ji ltar gnas pa'i chos nyid de la yang phyin ci log gi rjes su 'brang ba 'dren po phyogs bslad pa lta bu dag rnam pa gzhan du yongs su
translated: Our treatise is a teaching of the ultimate reality as it is, and it is of great importance. But the ultimate reality as it is has been imagined in a different way by those who follow the wrong path, who are like the honest man misled by the wrong direction.

original: rtog go // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rtog go // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Dependent origination is not produced by own nature.

original: phyin ci log pa'i bdag nyid du ma byung ba yin na so so'i skye bo dag de la ngo bo nyid kyis skye bar yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i bdag nyid du ma byung ba yin na so so'i skye bo dag de la ngo bo nyid kyis skye bar yongs su rtog ste /
translated: It has not come into existence as having a nature of error. But the ordinary people imagine that it is produced by own nature.

original: de la mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: And, being attached to it, they are defiled.

original: kun nas nyon mongs de spang pa'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs de spang pa'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: In order to abandon that defilement, the Blessed Buddha, the best of the teachers of the true knowledge, has taught the disciples, the self-enlightened ones, and the bodhisattvas,

original: brten nas skyes pa ma @27b skyes she'o //
analyzed: brten nas skyes pa ma @27b skyes she'o //
translated: That which is produced in dependence is not produced.

original: sgyu ma mkhan ni sgyu ma'i na chung yang dag pa snyam du mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan ni sgyu ma'i na chung yang dag pa snyam du mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The magician does not become defiled by lustful thoughts about the illusory woman, thinking her to be real.

original: na chung yang dag pa snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal can phyin ci log tu gyur ba de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: na chung yang dag pa snyam du mngon pa'i nga rgyal can phyin ci log tu gyur ba de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: But the one who is deluded by the illusion, who thinks the illusory woman is real, becomes defiled.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang brten nas byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes so zhes bcom ldan 'das gsungs pas dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang brten nas byung ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes so zhes bcom ldan 'das gsungs pas dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the Lord has said that things arise in dependence, and that they do not arise inherently. Thus, he has taught that things do not exist inherently.üîΩThus, it is said:

original: 'di ltar / log pa'i shes pas zil gnon pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / log pa'i shes pas zil gnon pa //
translated: The one who is overcome by false views

original: bden pa min la bden 'dzin pa'i //üîΩyongs su 'dzin dang rtsod sogs kyi //
analyzed: bden pa min la bden 'dzin pa'i // yongs su 'dzin dang rtsod sogs kyi //
translated: Grasps the unreal as real.üîΩFrom the sequence of grasping and dispute

original: rim pa chags las shin tu byung //
analyzed: rim pa chags las shin tu byung //
translated: Arises the sequence of attachment and so on.

original: de lta bas na dngos po bden pa ma yin pa bden par 'du shes pa de bzlog pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po bden pa ma yin pa bden par 'du shes pa de bzlog pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Lord has taught dependent origination in order to reverse the conception of reality in things that are not real.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni slu ba'i phyir bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni slu ba'i phyir bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Dependent origination is not true because it is deceptive.

original: de bden pa ma yin par rtogs na dngos po la chags pa ldog go //
analyzed: de bden pa ma yin par rtogs na dngos po la chags pa ldog go //
translated: When one understands that it is not true, attachment to entities is stopped.

original: dngos po la chags pa log na dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa ldog go //
analyzed: dngos po la chags pa log na dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa ldog go //
translated: When attachment to entities is stopped, grasping of entities is stopped.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa ni bdag gir byed pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa ni bdag gir byed pa ste /
translated: Grasping is taking as one‚Äôs own.

original: de ni de ltar ldog go //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ldog go //
translated: That is stopped in that way.

original: de log la 'dod pa la chags par gyur pa dang / lta ba la chags par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa yang ldog go //
analyzed: de log la 'dod pa la chags par gyur pa dang / lta ba la chags par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa yang ldog go //
translated: When that is stopped, the dispute that arises from attachment to desire and attachment to views is also stopped.

original: rtsod pa log na 'thab pa la sogs pa yang ldog go //
analyzed: rtsod pa log na 'thab pa la sogs pa yang ldog go //
translated: When the dispute is stopped, fighting and so forth are also stopped.

original: de bas na dngos po brten nas grub pa gang yang mi dmigs na gdon mi za bar /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po brten nas grub pa gang yang mi dmigs na gdon mi za bar /
translated: Therefore, when one does not observe any entity that is established in dependence, then without a doubt

original: rtsod med che ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rtsod med che ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The great beings who are free from dispute

original: de dag la ni phyogs med do //
analyzed: de dag la ni phyogs med do //
translated: Do not have a position.

original: rang gi phyogs khas len pa yod na ni de'i tshe de gzugs pa'i phyir gzhan rnams dang rtsod par gyur na de dag la ni de lta bu yang med pas de bas na rtsod med che ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs khas len pa yod na ni de'i tshe de gzugs pa'i phyir gzhan rnams dang rtsod par gyur na de dag la ni de lta bu yang med pas de bas na rtsod med che ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: If one has a position of one‚Äôs own, then one would be arguing with others in order to prove that. But since they do not have such a position, they are of the nature of being free from dispute.

original: gal te de dag la rang gi phyogs med du zin kyang gzhan gyi phyogs gzhig pa med mi srid de /
analyzed: gal te de dag la rang gi phyogs med du zin kyang gzhan gyi phyogs gzhig pa med mi srid de /
translated: Even if they do not have a position of their own, it is not possible for them to be without refuting the positions of others.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi phyogs yod dang // bdag gi phyogs kyang med du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi phyogs yod dang // bdag gi phyogs kyang med du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, they have the position of others, and it is not possible for them to be without their own position.

original: phyogs shig yod na ni bdag gi phyogs sam gzhan gyi phyogs med par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: phyogs shig yod na ni bdag gi phyogs sam gzhan gyi phyogs med par yang 'gyur na /
translated: If they had a position, then they would have either their own position or the position of others.

original: gang gi tshe phyogs ye med de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyogs ye med de'i tshe /
translated: But when they have no position at all,üîΩHow can they have the position of others?

original: gang rnams la ni phyogs med pa //
analyzed: gang rnams la ni phyogs med pa //
translated: Since they have no position of their own,

original: de la gzhan phyogs ga la yod //
analyzed: de la gzhan phyogs ga la yod //
translated: How can they have the position of others?

original: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po med pas bdag dang @28a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po med pas bdag dang @28a * //
translated: When it is like this, since there are no things, they do not have a position of their own.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs med pa de'i tshe de ltar mthong ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams nges par 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs med pa de'i tshe de ltar mthong ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams nges par 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the other side is not there, then the afflictions of those who see it in that way will definitely cease.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: de dag 'di ltar /
analyzed: de dag 'di ltar /
translated: They are like this:

original: gang yang rung ba'i gnas rnyed nas //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i gnas rnyed nas //
translated: Having found some place to stay,

original: nyon mongs sbrul gdug g-yon can gyis //üîΩzin par 'gyur ro gang gi sems //
analyzed: nyon mongs sbrul gdug g-yon can gyis // zin par 'gyur ro gang gi sems //
translated: they are seized by the deceitful, poisonous snake of the afflictions.

original: gnas med de dag zin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas med de dag zin mi 'gyur //
translated: But those whose minds have no place to stay are not seized by them.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'du byed kyi nags thibs bo na rgyu ba dge ba'i phyogs kyi srog gi bar chad byed pa lta ba la sogs pa'i mig gi dbang po'i phug tu gnas bcas pa yul gyi rlung la yid chags pa yun ringüîΩpo nas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'du byed kyi nags thibs bo na rgyu ba dge ba'i phyogs kyi srog gi bar chad byed pa lta ba la sogs pa'i mig gi dbang po'i phug tu gnas bcas pa yul gyi rlung la yid chags pa yun ring po nas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Attachment and so on move naturally in the thick forest of formations, interrupting the life of the wholesome side, and dwell in the eye faculty of views and so on, following for a long time the wind of objects that the mind is attached to.

original: g-yon can ni gya gyu ltar 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: g-yon can ni gya gyu ltar 'gro ba ste //
translated: They are deceitful because they move crookedly.

original: 'dzin pa la brtson pas de dag ni sbrul lo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la brtson pas de dag ni sbrul lo //
translated: They are snakes because they strive to grasp.

original: gnas brten par bya ba rgyu 'ga' zhig rnyed nas 'ga' zhig la 'dzin to //
analyzed: gnas brten par bya ba rgyu 'ga' zhig rnyed nas 'ga' zhig la 'dzin to //
translated: Having found some cause to dwell on, they grasp something.

original: gang dag dngos po thams cad du mi dmigs pas nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gyis gnas pa'i rgyu ma lus par bsregs shing dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi dbang po'i phug rnams bkag pa de dag nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gyis zin par 'gyur ba'i gnas med par byas pas
analyzed: gang dag dngos po thams cad du mi dmigs pas nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gyis gnas pa'i rgyu ma lus par bsregs shing dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi dbang po'i phug rnams bkag pa de dag nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gyis zin par 'gyur ba'i gnas med par byas pas
translated: Those who, by not apprehending any entity, have burned up the entire body of causes for the snake of the afflictions to lie in wait, and have closed off the openings of the faculties with mindfulness and vigilance, have made it impossible for the snake of the afflictions to seize them.

original: gang dag gi sems la gnas pa med pa ni zin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag gi sems la gnas pa med pa ni zin par 'gyur te /
translated: For those whose minds are without a basis, there is nothing to seize.

original: dngos por dmigs pa med na sems kyi phyogs yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por dmigs pa med na sems kyi phyogs yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no apprehension of an entity, the mind does not grasp any aspect.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gang dag gis sems la dmigs pa med pa de dag nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gdug pa g-yon can gyis kyang tshugs shing zin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gang dag gis sems la dmigs pa med pa de dag nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gdug pa g-yon can gyis kyang tshugs shing zin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this way, those whose minds are without an object cannot be seized even by the deceitful, poisonous snake of the afflictions.

original: gang dag gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dmigs kyang nyon mongs pa rnams spang du rung bar 'dod pa de dag la ni nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dmigs kyang nyon mongs pa rnams spang du rung bar 'dod pa de dag la ni nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: For those who maintain that the afflictions can be eliminated even though the intrinsic reality of form, etc. is perceived, it is taught that the afflictions cannot be eliminated.

original: gnas dang bcas pa'i sems yod la //üîΩnyon mongs dug chen cis mi 'byung //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa'i sems yod la // nyon mongs dug chen cis mi 'byung //
translated: If the mind is present with a basis,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: why would the great poison of the afflictions not occur?

original: dngos por dmigs na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'byung ba gdon mi za bar mi zlog ste 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dngos por dmigs na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'byung ba gdon mi za bar mi zlog ste 'byung ngo //
translated: If one perceives things, the occurrence of the afflictions such as attachment is certainly not averted; they occur.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩgal te dngos po de yid dang mthun par gnas na ni de'i tshe de la rjes su chags pa bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / gal te dngos po de yid dang mthun par gnas na ni de'i tshe de la rjes su chags pa bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How so?üîΩIf that thing abides in accordance with the mind, then it is difficult to avert attachment to it.

original: @28b ci ste mi mthun na yang de'i tshe de la khong khro ba dang / tshig pa za ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @28b ci ste mi mthun na yang de'i tshe de la khong khro ba dang / tshig pa za ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not in accordance with the mind, then it is difficult to avert aversion and anger toward it.

original: 'on te rtog pa de gnyis ka bstsal kyang de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo la sgro 'dogs shing dmigs pa las byung ba btang snyoms su 'gyur ba'i yul la ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa de gnyis ka bstsal kyang de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo la sgro 'dogs shing dmigs pa las byung ba btang snyoms su 'gyur ba'i yul la ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if both of these thoughts are abandoned, then the object of the latent impressions of ignorance, which is the basis of the superimposition of the essence of things, would be difficult to overcome.

original: tha mal bar 'dug pa'i gnas na kun tu 'byung ba'i ma rig pa'i bag la nyal 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang mthun pa gnod pa'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa'i sbrul 'byung bar dmigs nas /
analyzed: tha mal bar 'dug pa'i gnas na kun tu 'byung ba'i ma rig pa'i bag la nyal 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang mthun pa gnod pa'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa'i sbrul 'byung bar dmigs nas /
translated: In the state of ordinary existence, the latent impressions of ignorance that arise are conducive to the arising of the suffering of cyclic existence, and one observes the arising of the snake of affliction, which is harmful.

original: gang tshe tha mal 'dug pa yang //
analyzed: gang tshe tha mal 'dug pa yang //
translated: When one is in an ordinary state,

original: nyon mongs sbrul gyis zin par 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs sbrul gyis zin par 'gyur //
translated: one is seized by the snake of affliction.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang gi tshe gti mug de rtag tu 'byung bar gyur ba de ni kun tu rmongs pa de kho na mthong ba bsgribs pa'i so so'i skye bo dag gti mug gi mthus grub pa'i dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid la gdon mi za bar //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gti mug de rtag tu 'byung bar gyur ba de ni kun tu rmongs pa de kho na mthong ba bsgribs pa'i so so'i skye bo dag gti mug gi mthus grub pa'i dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid la gdon mi za bar //
translated: When that delusion always arises, then those ordinary beings who are obscured by the vision of reality, by the power of delusion, undoubtedly superimpose the essence of things that are established by their own characteristics.

original: byis pa bden par 'du shes pas //
analyzed: byis pa bden par 'du shes pas //
translated: Just as a child, due to the conception of true existence,

original: gzugs brnyan la ni chags pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la ni chags pa bzhin //
translated: is attached to a reflection,

original: de ltar 'jig rten rmongs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten rmongs pa'i phyir //
translated: so, due to the delusion of the world,

original: yul gyi gzeb la thogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: yul gyi gzeb la thogs par 'gyur //
translated: one is caught in the cage of objects.

original: ji ltar byis pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi shes pa rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa blun pa dag gzugs brnyan dmigs pa na de la dngos po yod par 'dzin zhing chags par 'gyur te ci yang byed cing de dang rtse ba de bzhin du byis
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi shes pa rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa blun pa dag gzugs brnyan dmigs pa na de la dngos po yod par 'dzin zhing chags par 'gyur te ci yang byed cing de dang rtse ba de bzhin du byis
translated: Just as a child, who does not know the conventions of the world, who is by nature dull-witted, when observing a reflection, grasps at it as if it were a real thing and becomes attached to it, and then does all sorts of things, playing with it, in the same way,

original: pa ma rig pa dang ldan pa gti mug gi mthus skyes pa la /
analyzed: pa ma rig pa dang ldan pa gti mug gi mthus skyes pa la /
translated: the child, who is born under the influence of the power of delusion, due to being endowed with ignorance,

original: dngos po yod pa yang dag par rtsod pa la mngon par zhen pa lus dang ngag yid kyis 'jug pas /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa yang dag par rtsod pa la mngon par zhen pa lus dang ngag yid kyis 'jug pas /
translated: grasps at the existence of real things, and is attached to them, and engages in them with body, speech, and mind.

original: de dang de la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: de dang de la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: Due to being attached to them,

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal la sogs pas rang dbang med par 'jug pa byis pa bzhin du ci dang ci yang byed cing 'khor ba'i gzeb la thogs pa 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid mi shes pa dag mi 'phags pa rnams la snying brtse ba'i yul du snang ngo //
